lexUnit.name: wellington.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: ly Brit. a knee-length waterproof rubber or plastic boot.

sentence.text: Still clad in her tattered working clothes , her wellingtons pumped away assiduously to give the instrument the breath it required .
We parked the cars beside the Institute of Terrestrial Ecology 's Experimental Station ( Monks Wood is the most thoroughly researched wood in the country ! ) and changed into our wellingtons .
Peter Gaskell shuffled through in his oversized wellingtons , a large empty canvas bag flapping against his knees .
Kicking off his muddy wellingtons , he walked across to the towel rail on the far side of the old-fashioned kitchen .
Even in wellingtons , he could move as lightly as a squirrel .
Maud , sensible in trench-coat and wellingtons , her head still scarfed , strode up to the wrought-iron gate across the porch , which was bolted and padlocked .
Led by a small boy in shorts and singlet and over-large wellingtons , a herd of cows was coming in from the fields .
Opposite , number 47 in huge green wellingtons and baseball cap was talking to number 60 .
She kicked off the wellingtons , which was easy enough , and began to go up the ladder .
He wore a tweed hat , the brim turned down , a waterproof shooting jacket and wellingtons .

We visit the charming sheep and I get a chance to wear my wellingtons after all .
